para: SegmentSide selects the left or right side of an &elem; &sgmt; when evaluating Outputs on a .

When evaluating an Output along a &sgmt; separating two &elems;, the result may depend upon whether the evaluation point is considered to be in one &elem; or the other, because &fields; and &fluxes; may be discontinuous at the boundary. &skel; edge boundaries are directed, having a beginning and an end, so it's possible to specify which &elem; to use for the evaluation by choosing the one on the left or right side of the boundary. Left means On the left if you were on the boundary and facing towards its end.
If a boundary is external and only has an &elem; on one side, that element will be used regardless of the SegmentSide selected.
